questions.question: Barbiturates exert the following actions EXCEPT:
Currently barbiturates are primarily used as:
Benzodiazepines differ from barbiturates in the following aspects EXCEPT:
options: They have a steeper dose response curve
They do not induce microsomal drug metabolizing enzymes

questions.question: Select the correct statement about benzodiazepines (BZDs):
options: All BZDs facilitate GABA mediated Cl influx into neurones
Different BZDs exert the same degrees of hypnotic, anxiolytic and anticonvulsant actions
The BZD receptor is homogeneous at all neuronal sites
The muscle relaxant action of BZDs is not blocked by flumazenil

questions.question: The primary mechanism of action of benzodiazepines is:
Select the drug that antagonises diazepam action competitively:
The following is a very potent and short acting benzodiazepine used as hypnotic:
Zolpidem differs from diazepam in that:
options: Its hypnotic action shows little daytime sleeping
It causes more marked suppression of REM sleep
It has more potent muscle relaxant action

questions.question: The following drug is used to reverse the CNS depression produced by diazepam:
Select the correct statement about flumazenil:
options: It is a CNS stimulant used as an antidote for benzodiazepine poisoning
It is a CNS depressant but blocks the action of diazepam
It has no CNS effect of its own but blocks the depressant effects of benzodiazepines as well as barbiturates
It has no CNS effect of its own but blocks the depressant effect of diazepam

questions.question: Clonazepam is a benzodiazepine used as:
Which of the following is a nonsedative anxiolytic:
The following statement is correct about buspirone:
options: It interacts with benzodiazepine receptor as an inverse agonist
It is a rapidly acting anxiolytic, good for panic states
It produces physical dependence and suppresses barbiturate withdrawal syndrome
It has anxiolytic but no anticonvulsant or muscle relaxant property

questions.question: Select the drug which relieves anxiety but neither reacts with benzodiazepine receptor nor produces any overt CNS effect:
The preferred class of drugs for long term treatment of severe anxiety disorder with intermittent panic attacks is:
The nonselective MAO inhibitors are not used clinically as antidepressants because of their:
options: Potential to interact with many foods and drugs

questions.question: Which of the following MAO inhibitors is most likely to produce cheese reaction:
'Cheese reaction' in a MAO inhibited patient manifests as:
options: Precipitous fall in blood pressure and shock

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Clinical improvement of anxiety requires 2 to 4 weeks of treatment with benzodiazepines.
All benzodiazepines have some sedative effects.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a short-acting hypnotic?
Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Diazepam and phenobarbital induce the cytochrome P450 enzyme system.
Phenobarbital induces respiratory depression, which is enhanced by the consumption of ethanol.
Buspirone has actions similar to those of the benzodiazepines.

questions.question: A 45-year-old man who has been injured in a car accident is brought into the emergency room. His blood alcohol level on admission is 275 mg/dL.Hospital records show a prior hospitalization for alcohol related seizures. His wife confirms that he has been drinking heavily for 3 weeks. What treatment should be provided to the patient if he goes into withdrawal?
A 24-year-old stockbroker with generalized anxiety disorder is prescribed Buspirone. What should the physician inform the patient?
options: Need to continually increase dosage because of tolerance
Significant effect of the drug on memory
Additive CNS depression with alcoholic beverages
Drug likely to take two weeks or more to begin working

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of benzodiazepines?
options: Activate GABAB receptors in the spinal cord
Block glutamate receptors in hierarchical neuronal pathways in the brain
Increase frequency of opening of chloride ion channels coupled to GABAA receptors
Stimulate release of GABA from nerve endings in the brain

questions.question: This drug used in insomnia facilitates inhibitory actions of GABA, lacks anticonvulsant or muscle-relaxing properties, minimal effect on sleep architecture, and is antagonized by flumazenil.
Which antipsychotic drug has the lowest risk of tardive dyskinesia?
Which of the following is a pharmacological action of diazepam?
Which benzodiazepine would be prescribed for a short period to a patient with early insomnia?
The following action of chlorpromazine is not based on its anti-dopaminergic property:
Chlorpromazine therapy increases the secretion of the following hormone:
The major limitation in the use of clozapine for treatment of schizophrenia is:
options: Its inability to benefit negative symptoms of schizophrenia
High incidence of extrapyramidal side effects

questions.question: What is true of Risperidone:
options: It is an atypical neuroleptic which produces few extrapyramidal side effects
It has combined dopamine D2 and 5-HT2 receptor blocking activity

questions.question: The following antipsychotic drug has weak dopamine D2 but additional 5-HT2 blocking activity and benefits both positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia:
The following adverse effect can occur even long after withdrawal of the offending drug:
The psychotic symptoms most benefited by typical neuroleptic drugs are:
An adolescent male newly diagnosed with schizophrenia may improve apathy and blunted emotion with which neuroleptic agent?
A young male patient develops severe muscle cramps with torticollis shortly after haloperidol therapy. The best term to describe this side effect is:
Which of the following drugs has a high affinity for 5-HT2 receptors in the brain, does not cause extrapyramidal dysfunction or hematotoxicity?
Which antipsychotic drug has the lowest risk of tardive dyskinesia?
Which of the following is a pharmacological action of diazepam?
Which benzodiazepine would be prescribed for a short period to a patient with early insomnia?
Which antipsychotic drug is more suitable for an obese patient?
Which of the following is the main mechanism of action of 1st generation antipsychotic drugs?
Which benzodiazepine would be prescribed for early insomnia?
Which selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) is more sedating?
